document.docAuthor: Kim, Young-Hyo, Hendrycks, Ed A. & Lee, Kyung-Sook
document.docTitle: Sinoediceros hwanghaensis Kim & Hendrycks & Lee 2012, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: New genera and species of the Synchelidium group (Amphipoda: Oedicerotidae) from Asia-North Pacific

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New genera and species of the Synchelidium group (Amphipoda: Oedicerotidae) from Asia-North Pacific

subSubSection.paragraph: (Korean name: Hwang-hae-but-eun-nun-yeop-sae-u, new)

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Holotype .
Adult female. Body 4.5 mm (appendages on one slide), NIBRIV0000246432, Namdong-ri Jindo Island , Korea (34 ◦ 21 ′ 44 ′′ N, 126 ◦ 09 ′ 01 ′′ E),
29 June 2004
, sieved mud, collected by Y.-H. Kim.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Paratypes .
Three females, 3.1–5.0 mm, CMNC 2012-0014 , other data same as holotype
;
30 females , 2.5–4.2 mm , DKU 201206 , other data same as holotype
.

Additional material examined. One female, Boleumdo Island, Korea (37 ◦ 39 ′ 47 ′′ N, 126 ◦ 12 ′ 38 ′′ E), 26 April 2001 , sieved mud;
10 females , Narodo beach, Oenalodo Island , Korea (34 ◦ 28 ′ 07 ′′ N, 127 ◦ 28 ′ 16 ′′ E),
31 July 2001
, sieved mud
;
19 females , Dochodo Island , Korea (34 ◦ 39 ′ 42 ′′ N, 125 ◦ 56 ′ 51 ′′ E),
14 September 2002
, sieved mud; one female, Jungwang-ri , Seosan-si , Korea (36 ◦ 53 ′ 12 ′′ N, 126 ◦ 22 ′ 49 ′′ E),
25 September 2002
, sieved mud
;
19 females , Daewhang-ri , Seosan-si , Korea (36 ◦ 50 ′ 14 ′′ N, 126 ◦ 21 ′ 27 ′′ E),
25 September 2002
, sieved mud
;
34 females , Bongjeon-ri Yeosu-si , Korea (34 ◦ 48 ′ 41 ′′ N, 127 ◦ 31 ′ 25 ′′ E),
21 March 2004
, sieved mud. All material collected by Y.-H. Kim.
The new species is named after the main collecting location. The Korean name for the Yellow Sea is Hwanghae.

Holotype female.
Body ( Figure 10A ) 4.5 mm long, head as long as pereonites 1–3 combined, narrowing anteriorly; rostrum subacute apically, reaching about 0.3 times peduncular article 1 of antenna 1; lateral cephalic lobe acute; trace of ommatidia not observed.

caption.paragraph:
Figure 10.
Sinoediceros hwanghaensis
sp. nov. , holotype, female, 4.5 mm: (A) habitus; (B) antenna 1; (C) antenna 2; (D) lower lip (from paratype, 4.3 mm); (E) left mandible; (F) right mandible; (G) maxilla 1; (H) maxilla 2; (I) maxilliped. Scale bars = 0.5 mm (A), 0.2 mm (B, C), 0.05 mm (D–I).

subSubSection.paragraph: Gnathopod 2 ( Figure 11B ) very similar to gnathopod 1 in form, but each article slightly longer and larger in proportion than gnathopod 1.

caption.paragraph:
Figure 11.
Sinoediceros hwanghaensis
sp. nov. , holotype, female, 4.5 mm: (A) gnathopod 1; (B) gnathopod 2; (C) pereopod 3; (D) pereopod 4; (E) pereopod 5. Scale bar = 0.2 mm.

Figure 12.
Sinoediceros hwanghaensis
sp. nov. , holotype, female, 4.5 mm: (A) pereopod 6; (B) pereopod 7; (C) pleonites; (D) uropod 1; (E) uropod 2; (F) uropod 3; (G) telson. Scale bars = 0.4 mm (C), 0.2 mm (A, B, D–F), 0.1 mm (G).

subSubSection.paragraph: Pleopods strong, rami long, subequal, articles with long plumose setae.
Male. Unknown.

Before our study,
Sinoediceros homopalmulus Shen, 1955
represented a monotypic genus that was reported from the coastal waters of the East China Sea.
Sinoediceros hwanghaensis
sp. nov. is differentiated from
S . homopalmulus
by the following characteristics (
S . homopalmulus
characters in parentheses): 1) flagellum of antenna 2 very short, 0.25 times peduncle (vs. 0.45 times peduncle); 2) the carpal lobe of gnathopod 2 extending just beyond posterior end of propodus (vs. greatly exceeding posterior end of propodus); 3) rami of uropod 3 slightly longer than peduncle, about 1.1 times peduncle (vs. much longer than peduncle, about 1.5 times peduncle); 4) mandibular palp article 3 elongate, subequal to article 2 (short, 0.5 times article 2); and 5) outer plate of the maxilliped elongate, reaching 0.75 times palp article 2 (vs. short, reaching palp article 1).
Korea (Yellow Sea, Korea Strait).

1. Antenna 2 flagellum long, about 0.45 times peduncles; carpal lobe of gnathopod 2 greatly exceeding propodus; rami of uropod 3 elongate, about 1.5 times peduncle; outer plate of maxilliped short, reaching palp article 1................................................
S. homopalmulus Shen, 1955
Antenna 2 flagellum very short, 0.25 times peduncles; carpal lobe of gnathopod 2 extending just beyond propodus; rami of uropod 3 about 1.1 times peduncle; outer plate of maxilliped elongate, greatly exceeding palp article 1..........................................
S. hwanghaensis
sp. nov.
